title: Integration Studio
content:
The Integration Studio is a built-in integration platform that enables you to set up an integration with another Service Management system or an external application.

Complete the following steps to access the Integration Studio:

  1. Log in to the Agent Interface.
  2. Go to Administration > Utilities > Integration.
  3. In the Integration Management list, select Integration Studio.

To use the Integration Studio, you must have the Integration Administrator role. For example, to create or configure Integration Studio-related endpoints, integrations, and scenarios, you must have the Integration Administrator role.

The Integration Studio has the following capabilities:

  • On-Premises Bridge (OPB) Agent support: Enables you to specify an OPB agent for the endpoint systems so that Service Management can connect to systems behind a firewall.
  • Built-in platform: Enables you to manage case exchange type of integrations without the involvement of third-party products.
  • Codeless: Allows you to build integrations without the need to write complex code logic.
  • Modern user interface: Provides a simple, intuitive, and modern user interface with rich capabilities to build and manage integrations.
  • Predefined templates: Comes with predefined templates to facilitate integration creation.

Main components

The following table describes the main components of the Integration Studio.

Component Description
Endpoint

An endpoint defines the details to connect to an application including authentication details, certificates, data transport protocols, base URLs, and so on.
Connector

A connector is a metadata-driven definition of the API for the application to integrate with. It defines the supported actions for the application to integrate with.​
Integration / Scenario
  • An integration represents the top-level container for all the integration logic related to the applications to integrate with. An integration supports integrations with up to three applications. An integration can have one or more scenarios.​ 
  • A scenario consists of a sequence of rules that implement a specific integration logic.​ The Integration Studio offers predefined scenario templates to help users build their own integration logic more quickly.
Action

An action normally represents the definition of a Web Service interface for the application to integrate with or the local system. There are also special actions (called common actions) that assist with scenario logic composition and data preparation.
Rule A rule is based on an action and represents the instance of the action in the scenario. Within the rule, all parameters defined in the action become configurable to ensure that data is properly prepared for each specific scenario.

When the Integration Studio is used to transform, manipulate, and exchange data, there are several ways to interact with Service Management and the target system. The Integration Studio manages records in Service Management as well as in the target system.

Currently it is not possible to directly send a request to the Integration Studio.

Integration modes

You can use the following Integration Studio modes to integrate Service Management with a target system.

  • ACTIVE – ACTIVE

    Both systems are actively pushing data to the target system.

    Both systems need to be configured to trigger the data push to the other system.

  • ACTIVE – PASSIVE

    One system is pushing data to the target system.

    The same system is regularly pulling data from the target system.

    Only the active system needs to be configured to trigger the data exchange with the target system.

  • ACTIVE – SEMI-ACTIVE

    One system is pushing data to the target system.

    The same system is pulling data from the target system, but only when a notification is received.

    Only the active system needs to be configured to trigger the data exchange with the target system.

Limitations

This section lists the limitations of the Integration Studio and On Premise Bridge.

Limitations of Integration Studio
  • The Integration Studio supports only REST API calls with JSON payloads for outbound integrations.
  • Listener-based inbound integrations support the following content types:  
    application/json
application/x-www-form-urlencoded
text/plain
Limitations of On Premise Bridge 
  • Request/Response Size Limit (50 KB): Rules will fail if the request or response body exceeds 50 KB.
  • Task Processing Delays (10s + 1s): The OPB Agent checks for new tasks every 10 seconds and syncs results every 1 second, causing at least an 11-second delay between rule executions.
  • Concurrency Limit (20 Threads): Only 20 rules can run simultaneously. Triggering more integrations will cause delays due to thread contention.
